Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of visa denial
Evidence_Assessment: Lack of financial means, unstable employment, no travel history, family ties in Canada (fiancé and sisters), weak ties to Haiti
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate intent to leave Canada after temporary stay
Legal_Rule: Visa officers may deny applications if there is insufficient proof of intent to leave Canada
Procedural_Issue: Allegation of lack of interview and unfair process
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision and breach of procedural fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Financial status, employment stability, travel history, family ties in Canada and Haiti
Applicant_Challenge: Decision was unreasonable and procedurally unfair
Defendant_Response: Visa officer acted within discretionary authority
Remedy_Requested: Overturn visa denial and grant visa
Legal_Provision: Section of Immigration and Refugee Protection Act regarding temporary resident visas
Authority: Canadian visa officer and Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to demonstrate intent to leave Canada
Applicable_Process: Visa application and judicial review process
Governing_Rule: Visa officers have discretion to assess applicant’s intent to return
